intro: Chilita fraileana, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually glossy and dark green, and it thrives in warm, humid environments. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its vibrant flowers and adaptability to various soil types. Chilita fraileana is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees.
